column4: Is there a net install of ubuntu?  From my experience the cd install of ubuntu is COMPLETELY broken
can you describe the bugs you've come across and file them on the bugzilla if you've found them
hmm, where to begin.
start at the beginning, your experience seems to have differed to most people's experience---and we'd like to fix any problems you've found as in the future somebody else may have the same problem
okay, so this first problem (hwclock) isn't anything to do with the installer?
you can say that it is not the installer, but until there is evidence that it is NOT the installer, I don't believe a word of that.
I appreicate your view point.  You mentioned that the machine 'freezes', is that just for short period, or forever
freeze, locked up, does not work, will not change for hours on end...whatever you prefer
so you can only solve this by a reboot?
yes...I smell something similar to windoze
if you start up in single-user mode and run   /etc/init.d/hwclock.sh start  manually, do you get a freeze at that point?
start up?  To what point.  The computer will not start up unless I boot from the CD
you mentioned that the kernel and operating system are loading until the point at which hwclock is run
when you get to the Boot-loader, select the safe/rescue option
that is the furthest point that I got to.  After reformatting the computer and trying the install again, the kernel could never get past that point
so the second time you've installed, the kernel never gets past /what/ point?
trying to install linux-386, then there is dependency hell...I smell rpm packages
Ubuntu is entirely deb based.  Can you provide the exact package you installed that is complaining of dependancy problems?
I am aware of Ubuntu's debian foundation, but I have had much better luck with debian
s/sucks/appears to exhibit bugs when talking to your machine/
true enough
so far you've described 1 issue, to do with hwclock, right?
damn, I want to type out everything I have said.  Scroll up the page for about 3 more issues
